posts.post_content:
Posted By: Ed McCollum
Card measures just slightly more than 1 7/16" x slightly less than 2 5/8". It's a beater. Rounded corners, heavy stains, multiple pin holes. Entire front surface of card has indentations/bumps that I liken to the surface of a golf ball. Sweet Cap 350-460 series back with scroll overstrike. Heavy staining and bumps on the back. Affordable example of the beautiful pastel Cobb. Asking $425. E-mail to buy or make offer. PayPal prefered. edmccollum@cox.net

[URL="http://s150.photobucket.com/albums/s81/T206ster/?action=view¤t=Cobb_BatOff_Front.jpg"][IMG]http://i150.photobucket.com/albums/s81/T206ster/Cobb_BatOff_Front.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

[URL="http://s150.photobucket.com/albums/s81/T206ster/?action=view¤t=Cobb_BattOff_Back.jpg"][IMG]http://i150.photobucket.com/albums/s81/T206ster/Cobb_BattOff_Back.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

From the scans, you can't see the bumping/indentations. They are there, and they cover the entire surface of the front of the card. Small, less than 1/16th inch each, but they are everywhere.
